intro: Cliffortia spicata, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are silvery-gray, covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Cliffortia spicata is often found in coastal areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
